item.name: Crown of the Forgotten
entries: The crown functions as a {@item +1 rod of the pact keeper|DMG}.

When you cast a warlock spell while wearing the crown, you can cause a slimy tentacle to rip through the fabric of reality and strike one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Crown of the Forgotten (Empowered)
entries: The crown functions as a {@item +2 rod of the pact keeper|DMG}.

When you cast a warlock spell while wearing the crown, you can cause a slimy tentacle to rip through the fabric of reality and strike one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.
The crown has 9 charges and regains {@dice 2d4 + 1} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Crown of Madness
entries: As an action, you can cast {@spell crown of madness} without needing to concentrate on it and you can maintain control as a bonus action. Once you used this feature, you can't use it again until next dawn.

entries.name: Mystic Regeneration
entries: As a bonus action, you can regain one use of your Mystic Arcanum feature. When you do so, you must expand a number of charges equal to the spell level of the regained mystic arcanum.

entries.name: Eldritch Ward
entries: When you use your Mystic Arcanum feature, you can expand 2 charge and gain temporary hit points equal to the level of your mystic arcanum times your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Hat of the Harpy (Plaguechanged)
entries: This masterfully crafted silk hat has a large purple feather on its side.

entries.name: Distracting Melody
entries: While you wear the hat, when a creature targets you directly with an attack or a harmful spell, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC (a creature needn't make the save when it includes you in an area effect, such as the explosion of {@spell fireball}). On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or forfeit targeting someone instead of you, potentially wasting the attack or spell. A creature is immune to this effect, if it is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition or can't hear you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Luring Song
entries: While you wear the hat, you can sing a magical melody. One humanoid and giant of your choice within 300 feet of you that can hear the song must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. You must take a bonus action on your subsequent turns to continue singing. You can stop singing at any time. The song ends if you are {@condition incapacitated}. While {@condition charmed} this way, a target is {@condition incapacitated}. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from you, the target must move on its turn toward you by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than you, the target can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until the dawn of the next day.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Chuthels spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Chuthel fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Chuthel can use its Frightful Presence. She then makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Chuthels choice that is within 120 feet and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Chuthels Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Psychic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Chuthel exhales psychoactive gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw, taking 77 ({@damage 22d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Chuthel makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Chuthel makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Chuthel beats her wings. Each creature within 15 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Chuthel can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The ancient purple dragon Chuthel (pronounced Ku-Tel) once struck a deal with the outer god Nyarlathotep in her persuit of knowledge. She used the forbidden knowledge gained to advance her evil schemes and formed the Circle of Thoth to honor Nyarlathotep and Azathoth. Over the decades, Chuthel has formed a cult around herself as well. Her most devoted followers are a tribe of purple kobolds, who obey every command she gives them, some mind flayers and even a fomorian. All of her followers simply call her mother and are just as insane as Chuthel herself.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The behir exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned}. If failed by 5 or more it is also {@condition paralyzed} and if failed by 10 or more the creature starts to sufface, as its lungs and heart stop working. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Psychic Gaze
entries: The glancer targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The behir has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Chaos Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
